intro: Ajania korovinii, commonly known as the Siberian ajania, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Siberia. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow, elongated, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Ajania korovinii is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
